# Sunoh.ai - Healthcare Ambient Documentation Solution

**Research Date:** November 21, 2025
**Vendor Category:** Ambient AI Medical Scribe
**Website:** https://sunoh.ai

---

## Executive Summary

Sunoh.ai is an AI-powered ambient listening medical scribe developed by healow (a division of eClinicalWorks). It captures patient-provider conversations and automatically generates clinical documentation. The solution targets small-to-medium practices, FQHCs, and independent providers with competitive per-visit pricing and EHR-agnostic design.

---

## 1. Company Profile

### Overview
| Attribute | Details |
|-----------|---------|
| **Company Name** | Sunoh.ai |
| **Parent Organization** | healow (eClinicalWorks) |
| **Founded** | 2023 (integration announced October 2023) |
| **Headquarters** | Westborough, MA (eClinicalWorks HQ) |
| **Funding Status** | Unfunded/Bootstrapped (subsidiary of eClinicalWorks) |
| **Stage** | Growth (90,000+ providers) |

### Leadership
- **Girish Navani** - CEO and Co-founder of eClinicalWorks
- **Rakhee Langer** - Vice President of Sunoh.ai and healow (leads business development, product strategy, implementation, and support)

### Parent Company Context
eClinicalWorks was founded in 1999 and is a leading cloud-based EHR and Practice Management vendor. More than 180,000 providers and nearly 1 million medical professionals rely on the eCW Cloud.

---

## 2. Product Offerings

### Core Product: AI Medical Scribe

**Ambient Documentation Platform** that captures natural patient-provider conversations and converts them into structured clinical notes.

### Key Capabilities
- **Ambient Listening**: Captures natural conversation without disrupting patient interactions
- **Real-time Transcription**: AI-powered voice recognition distinguishes between provider and patient voices
- **Automatic SOAP Note Generation**: Generates structured documentation from conversations
- **Order Capture**: Pre-fills labs, imaging, procedures, medication orders, and referrals
- **Multi-language Support**: English, Portuguese, and 20 dialects of Spanish
- **Multi-speaker Support**: Handles conversations with multiple participants

### Platform Availability
- iOS mobile app
- Android mobile app
- iPad app
- Desktop browser
- No special microphones or equipment required

---

## 3. Ambient AI Scribe Features

### Documentation Features
| Feature | Description |
|---------|-------------|
| **SOAP Notes** | Auto-generates Subjective, Objective, Assessment, Plan sections |
| **Progress Notes** | Traditional progress note format support |
| **DAP Notes** | Behavioral health-specific Data, Assessment, Plan format |
| **Specialty Templates** | Vision, orthopedics, rheumatology, dental, and more |
| **Coding Suggestions** | AI-suggested medical codes from encounter notes |

### Technical Capabilities
- **Natural Language Processing (NLP)**: Advanced algorithms for accurate transcription
- **Machine Learning**: Adapts to individual provider documentation styles
- **Accent Recognition**: Handles various accents and dialects
- **Voice Differentiation**: Distinguishes provider vs. patient voices

### Workflow Integration
- Review and modify generated summaries before import
- Single-click merge with pre-configured defaults
- Categorizes content into appropriate Progress Note sections
- Supports both in-office visits and telehealth appointments

---

## 4. Pricing Information

### Published Pricing Models

| Plan | Price | Details |
|------|-------|---------|
| **Per-Visit** | $1.25/visit | Pay-per-use model, no monthly commitment |
| **Monthly Subscription** | $149/month | Per user (limited-time pricing) |
| **Satisfaction Guarantee** | Yes | Offered on per-visit pricing |

### Cost Comparison
- Sunoh at $1.25/visit could document 31,000+ patient encounters for the cost of one human scribe (~$38,750/year)
- Significantly lower than enterprise competitors (Nuance DAX ~$600/user/month)
- Competitive with mid-market solutions (Suki $299-$399/month, Abridge ~$250/month)

---

## 5. Customer Testimonials & Reviews

### Provider Testimonials

**Time Savings:**
> "Cut down my time of documenting by 50% and does better job than before... Add diagnosis to my visit." - Software Advice Review

> "Dr. Annie Reinertsen's documentation time reduced by 50%, enhancing patient care and doubling visits."

**Work-Life Balance:**
> "Sunoh Ai has changed people's moods, people's attitudes, and people's satisfaction at work... Medications are being sent on time, referrals are being printed on time, appointments are made on time." - Dr. Mustafa Moazam, MD, Healthy Horizons Clinic

**Patient Care:**
> "I love that we can give our patients our 100% undivided attention so that we can keep our documentation and still be able to listen to them." - Brandy Peterson, Rocky Mountain Women's Clinic

### Customer Success Stories
| Organization | Results |
|--------------|---------|
| **Douglas County Family Practice (GA)** | 90% faster documentation, increased daily visits by 3-5 |
| **United Digestive** | 200+ visits documented in first week |
| **St. Croix Regional Family Health Center** | Saves 2 hours daily |
| **North Texas Preferred Health Partners** | 50% time savings on documentation |

### Third-Party Ratings
- **Capterra**: ~4/5 stars
- **Software Advice**: Starting at 4/5 stars with mixed detailed reviews
- **G2/GetApp**: Limited reviews available

### Known Limitations (User Feedback)
- Voice recognition challenges when provider/patient voices are similar
- No verbatim dictation command for Assessment & Plan sections
- Review of Systems and Physical Exam generation needs improvement
- Lab/medication ordering described as inconsistent
- Product activation process criticized as unclear/lengthy

---

## 6. EHR Integrations

### Fully Integrated
| EHR System | Integration Level |
|------------|-------------------|
| **eClinicalWorks** | Native/Deep integration (same parent company) |
| **Epic** | Available on fhir.epic.com App Orchard |
| **Oracle Health (Cerner)** | API integration |
| **Athenahealth** | Integrated |

### Integration Capabilities
- **EHR-Agnostic Design**: Works with any EHR system
- **FHIR API Support**: Standards-based connectivity
- **Direct Import**: SOAP notes import directly into EHR workflows
- **eClinicalMobile/eClinicalTouch**: Deep mobile EHR integration

---

## 7. Technology Stack

### Core Technologies
- **AI/ML Engine**: Proprietary natural language processing and machine learning algorithms
- **Speech Recognition**: Advanced voice recognition with accent handling
- **Cloud Infrastructure**: Cloud-based SaaS platform
- **Mobile Platform**: Native iOS and Android applications

### Security & Compliance
- **HIPAA Compliant**: Business Associate Agreements (BAA) available
- **Encryption**: Industry-standard encryption protocols
- **Administrative Safeguards**: Required HIPAA administrative controls
- **Physical Safeguards**: HIPAA-compliant physical security
- **Technical Safeguards**: HIPAA-compliant technical controls

---

## 8. Target Market

### Primary Segments

**1. Small & Independent Practices**
- Solo practitioners and small group practices
- Providers seeking affordable AI documentation
- Practices without IT infrastructure for complex deployments

**2. Federally Qualified Health Centers (FQHCs)**
- Significant market penetration in FQHC segment
- Notable customers: DePaul Community Health Centers (100 providers), HealthWorks for Northern Virginia (32 providers), Suncoast FQHC (75 providers across 9 locations)

**3. eClinicalWorks Users**
- Deep integration provides competitive advantage
- One-stop-shop with EHR + AI scribe + patient engagement

**4. Multi-Specialty Groups**
- Specialty-specific templates for various clinical areas
- Dental, behavioral health, orthopedics, vision, rheumatology

### Market Positioning
- **SMB-Focused**: Primary target vs. enterprise solutions like Nuance DAX
- **Value-Oriented**: Competitive pricing for budget-conscious practices
- **Mobile-First**: Accessible on any device without special equipment

---

## 9. Customer Count & Adoption

### Provider Metrics
| Metric | Value | Date |
|--------|-------|------|
| **Providers Using** | 90,000+ | November 2025 |
| **Earlier Report** | 80,000+ | Mid-2025 |
| **Earlier Report** | 60,000+ | 2024 |

### Growth Trajectory
- Rapid adoption growth from 60K to 90K+ providers in ~12 months
- Strong FQHC sector penetration
- Expanding beyond eClinicalWorks user base to other EHRs

---

## 10. Competitive Positioning

### Market Comparison

| Vendor | Best For | Price Point | Key Differentiator |
|--------|----------|-------------|-------------------|
| **Sunoh.ai** | SMB/FQHC/eCW users | $1.25/visit or $149/mo | Affordable, mobile-first, eCW integration |
| **Nuance DAX** | Large health systems | ~$600/user/mo | Enterprise-grade, Microsoft-backed, Epic depth |
| **Abridge** | Epic users, patient engagement | ~$250/mo | Patient recap PDFs, generative AI focus |
| **Suki** | Mobile-focused practices | $299-$399/mo | Voice assistant, mobile-native |
| **DeepScribe** | Mid-market practices | Not disclosed | Human QA, 98% accuracy claims |

### Competitive Advantages
1. **Price**: Lowest cost ambient AI scribe in market
2. **EHR-Agnostic**: Works with any system vs. EHR-locked competitors
3. **No Hardware**: No special microphones required
4. **Multilingual**: 20+ Spanish dialects, Portuguese, English
5. **eClinicalWorks Ecosystem**: Native integration advantage

### Competitive Disadvantages
1. **No KLAS Coverage**: Lacks third-party validation vs. competitors
2. **Enterprise Features**: Less suited for large health system deployments
3. **Parent Dependency**: Tied to eClinicalWorks reputation/ecosystem
4. **Accuracy Concerns**: Some user complaints about specific documentation areas

---

## 11. KLAS Research Coverage

### Current Status: **Not Covered**

As of November 2025, Sunoh.ai does **not appear in KLAS Research** Emerging Technology Spotlight reports or standard product ratings.

### Competitor KLAS Coverage
- **Abridge**: Featured in KLAS Emerging Technology 2024 report
- **DeepScribe**: KLAS Emerging Company Spotlight Report 2025
- **Nuance DAX**: Established KLAS ratings

### Implication
- Lack of third-party validation may impact enterprise sales cycles
- Competitors with KLAS ratings have validation advantage in RFP processes

---

## 12. 2025-2026 Roadmap

### Recent Developments (2025)
- Mobile app enhancements for iOS/Android/iPad
- In-workflow order pre-fill capabilities
- Expanded multilingual support (Spanish dialects)
- Multi-party visit handling improvements
- Dental clinic integration (announced May 2024)

### Partnership Announcements (2025)
- Hendry Regional Medical Center (May 2025)
- HOPE Clinic, Texas (April 2025)
- HealthWorks for Northern Virginia (February 2025)
- Large Primary Care Clinic in Florida (February 2025)
- Largest FQHC on East Coast (September 2025)

### Public Roadmap
**No formal public roadmap available.** Company does not publish forward-looking feature announcements.

### Anticipated Focus Areas (Based on Market Trends)
- Enhanced specialty templates
- Deeper EHR integrations beyond eClinicalWorks
- Improved voice differentiation accuracy
- Expanded language support
- Enterprise features for larger organizations

## 14. Assessment Summary

### Strengths
- Aggressive, transparent pricing ($1.25/visit)
- Strong eClinicalWorks ecosystem integration
- Rapid customer growth (60K to 90K+ in 12 months)
- Mobile-first, device-agnostic approach
- Multilingual capabilities
- FQHC market traction

### Weaknesses
- No KLAS Research coverage/validation
- Limited enterprise features
- Accuracy concerns in specific documentation areas
- Tied to eClinicalWorks parent company
- Limited public roadmap visibility

### Opportunities
- Expanding beyond eCW user base
- Enterprise market entry
- International expansion with multilingual capabilities
- KLAS certification pursuit

### Threats
- Well-funded competitors (Abridge $5.3B valuation)
- Microsoft/Nuance enterprise dominance
- EHR vendors building native ambient features
- Commoditization of ambient AI technology

### Recommendation
**Best fit for:** Small-to-medium practices, FQHCs, eClinicalWorks users, and cost-sensitive organizations seeking proven ambient AI documentation at competitive pricing.

**Not ideal for:** Large enterprise health systems requiring KLAS-validated solutions, deep Epic integrations, or advanced enterprise features.

---

*Research compiled: November 21, 2025*
